intro: Pentanema × hybridum, commonly known as the hybrid pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. However, it is relatively rare in the wild and is mainly found in specific high-altitude habitats.
